meanings.definition: To cool (a liquid) below its freezing point without solidification or crystallization.
meanings.sent1: I tried to supercool the water by placing it in the freezer for a longer time.
meanings.sent2: The scientist was able to supercool the liquid to a temperature below freezing.
meanings.sent3: The water thought it was too supercool for school and refused to freeze.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor was like a supercool liquid, never solidifying under pressure.
meanings.sent5: The idea of supercooling water seemed like magic, defying the laws of nature.

meanings.sent1: The superhero had a supercool costume that everyone admired.
meanings.sent2: The concert was supercool, with amazing lights and music.
meanings.sent3: The penguin thought wearing sunglasses made it look supercool.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was like a supercool breeze on a hot day, refreshing and impressive.
meanings.sent5: The new video game was supercool, capturing the attention of gamers everywhere.
